sen.e: Nagaoka-kyo had been called 'phantom capital' until recently, but members led by a high school teacher began to excavate the area in 1954 and found the site of the gate of the Daidairi Chodoin (a large hall at the front in the palace) in the following year; more excavation and research have been done to date (partly because research on the land has been required to meet the increased demand of land for industrial use and housing), and the site has been designated as a National Historical Site since 1964.
